Events > June 24, 2014

#111 2014 Urban Sustainability Apps Competition

Ed Oser from The Center for Neighborhood Technology (CNT) will give an overview of the Urban Sustainability Apps Competition.

If you plan on participating in the competition, this is your chance to get a head start on forming your teams and project ideas!

For everyone else, we will also have topic specific working groups to help guide conversations and potential apps:

  • Transportation: Steven Vance
  • Education: Elnaz Moshfeghian, Josh Kalov
  • Environment: Scott Beslow
  • City data: Gene Leynes, Tom Schenk
  • Orientation: Christopher Whitaker

Leadership Council Meeting #2

Will have our second open leadership discussion at 8pm after the presentations initial group breakouts. This meeting is for anyone who is interested in being involved in running the hack night, taking on new projects, or doing training sessions. If youâ€™d like to bring up a topic, add it to the agenda.
Sponsor GitHub and The Center for Neighborhood Technology
